description: Available for sale in our Redmond showroom is this fully restored, 1963 Lincoln Continental. This car was a 2 year, ground up restoration. The owner of this early 60's luxury sedan has spared no expense in making sure everything on this car has been done right. It's 430 cubic inch MEL V8 has been rebuilt and is accompanied by a Edelbrock 4 barrel carburetor, rebuilt transmission and new exhaust. It also has all new custom leather interior and a custom steering wheel.

The car has a new Midnight Blue (base coat and clear coat) paint job. The wheels and tires are new, along with the brake system and custom stereo system. This beauty is ready to roll down the road and look super cool doing it. This early 1960's example of pure luxury holds up to this day as one of the most luxurious automobiles ever built, not to mention the suicide doors!

It just doesn’t get any cooler than that. With the cool wheels, interior and all the rest, you have one Bad Ass Car!!!!!! This car is being offered at way less money than what the owner has invested, so hurry as it won’t last for long. Believe it or not, this one is ready to roll at $23,500.00. You could not begin to build this car for that kind of money. Call today, to set up a private viewing or inspection.  Hall Truck and Auto Sales has been quietly  selling vintage ,classic,collectable, and muscle cars in the northwest and across the country for over twenty years. With our recent expansion of our new Sherwood facility, we are the leaders in affordable cool classic rides throughout America and world wide sales for the car enthusiasts ,collectors and for those like us who simply appreciate the great era of the American made cars and trucks that pioneered the auto industry. Please feel free to contact us. We currently have dozens of cool classic rides to come that will be very affordable and competitively  priced anyone would be proud to own. We can assist in classic car  financing and transportation as well.Please feel free to call (541)548-1756 ROSS or (503)784-8876 Kelly Thank you for visiting

description: Up for sale in our Houston Showroom is this 1964 Lincoln Continental.  The Lincoln Continental is a series of luxury cars produced by Lincoln, a division of the American automaker Ford Motor Company. First introduced in 1939 as a coachbuilt convertible, which would spawn the personal luxury car segment.  The 4th generation Lincoln Continental was based on a stretched version of a proposed 1961 Thunderbird two-door hardtop that had been rejected as too classy and not sporty enough for the typical Thunderbird buyer. But while the four-seat Thunderbird was a relatively huge success, the Lincoln division was in danger of being culled. Designers and engineers worked hard at making a new, distinctive and profitable Lincoln. They succeeded admirably with the 4th Gen Continental.  Made famous by its rear-hinged Ã¢??suicideÃ¢?Â rear doors this car has found its way into countless movies, posters, & into many of the populations hearts.  This 64 Lincoln is a true beauty and is in excellent condition.  Staring with the outside of the car you will find a nice white paint that was restored and shows well.  All of the exterior chrome, trim, emblems, & hub caps are all in superb condition.  The doors open & close easily and line up as they should.  The white convertible top is in great condition, goes up & down as it should.  Looking at the interior you will not be disappointed.  A very nice deep red leather interior that is in like new condition & are comfortable enough to keep you driving all night long if desired.   The dash, steering wheel, carpet, & door panels look fantastic for being over 50 years old!  There were only 36k continentals built in 1964 and only a fraction of them are on the road today.  Most of them are in bad condition or fill with rust, but not this one!  This could be your opportunity to own one of most iconic and memorable cars of the 60Ã¢??s.  DonÃ¢??t let this opportunity pass you by as they are not on the market often!  This car features power seats, power windows, AC (not blowing cold), power brakes, wipers, power locks, white wall tires, CD player, leather interior, & a whole lotta coolness to go with it!
title: 1964 Lincoln Continental

description: 1973 Lincoln Continental Mark IVPRICE REDUCEDBeautiful black on black Custom paint with mural of angel on hood and sea horses on front fender wells. Electric sun roof . Top has been stripped and replaced with leather cow hide. Has been shown and won at World of Wheels in it's class three times. Also has been shown and won in many local car shows. Work history dates back to 1980's. Trophies plaques and history of car go with buyer.460 engine shaved 30% to 600 cubic in. 360 positive traction rear end. Edelbrock four barrel electronic carburetor and ignition with duel exhaust. Computer controlled transmission MSD ignition Mallory distributor modified to computer controlled. Duel fuel system with 10 gal fuel cell in trunk for racing fuel. Brass fuel lines braided in shrink covers. Remaining lines are stainless steel braide. Engine has been dressed out in chrome and stainless steel including headers. JVC stereo with remote control and booster in trunk.Interior roll and tuck very nice. Oiltemp and tack gauges mounted on dash. Quick switch to change to fuel cell can be adjusted to add richness to fuel or switch to fuel cell only.Please note mileage it is low....very low...due to over 30 plus years it has been driven mainly to and from car shows.This one of a kind sleeper is not only beautiful but is powerful with a duel exhaust that gives it a deep rumble. Over $400000.00 has been invested to achieve true show and sleeper quality.Vehicle is located in Anniston AL.Financing Nationwide Shipping and Warranties available to qualified buyers.

description: Gateway Classic Cars of Detroit is proud to offer this pristine 1970 Lincoln Continental Mark III. With only 52,398 actual miles, this Lincoln has been meticulously cared for and maintained over its life. Dressed in a beautiful deep blue metallic paint, this Mark III's long body lines gleam in the sun. The interior is as clean as the exterior done in a plush black leather. Powering this classic Continental is the numbers matching 460 Cubic Inch V8 engine with a 4BBL carburetor that pumps out 365 Horsepower which is plenty of power to move this full-sized luxury car. The 1970 Mark III was the first American made car to have radial tires as standard equipment. This three owner Lincoln is a perfect car for any collector, museum, or enthusiast and you would be hard pressed to find one in this condition. From the wood grain to the stainless trim, it is really something to sit in and be surrounded by 70's American luxury. If you're not into running the A/C then just hit the dual action power window switch and let the fresh air in as you cruise around town in this smooth floating ride. Other options on this pristine Lincoln include; Air Conditioning, AM/FM Radio, Cruise Control, Power Brakes, Power Steering, Power Door Locks, Power Seats, Power Windows, Tilt Steering Wheel, Seat Belts, Leather Interior, and White Wall Tires wrapped around factory hub caps. To view this 1970 Lincoln Continental Mark III in greater high definition photographs and a full high definition video please visit www.gatewayclassiccars.com, for more information on this vehicle please contact one of our friendly and knowledgeable staff at 313-982-3100.

description: For sale in our Orlando Florida showroom is a beautiful  1956 Lincoln Premiere. One look at those long sleek fenders, massive front grill and huge chrome bumpers make you fall in love with this classic styling. Lincoln was producing some beautiful cars in the 1950's but this bold yet luxurious styling really stood out even among the ultra-luxury segment and the distinguished buyers were treated to a plethora of options that some cars today are void of. The list of these goodies include power brakes, power steering, power windows,  Factory Air conditioning, a power adjustable front seat, AM FM  radio. This particular vehicle is a true survivor . This well preserved original is finished in Summit Green and Starmist White and  interior finished in Cream Vinyl. Check out that rear seat that easily has room for 4 or 5 people and the trunk which has more space than some apartments. In addition to a lifetime of care this car has had recent work done to make it reliable . This car is truly one of a kind... Located in our Orlando Florida  showroom this 1956 Lincoln Premiere can be seen including an HD video and pictures at www.gatewayclassiccars.com. For additional information please call 407-771-2000 or email Orlando@gatewayclassiccars.com - See more at: http://www.gatewayclassiccars.com/orlando/1956/lincoln/premiere-S845.html
title: 1956 Lincoln Premiere
